Material Drifter

About Bits + Bops Fibers Film Prints Reflections Zines Contact

silver maple way

I open the door to
sun and cold and wind
to lives held in the homes I pass
dreaming up my own in each
to crunching leaves
and dogs that bark
the church bell tolling
through distant trees
exacting counts of movements
in a day
sweet and familiar and pulling me out
like rail whistles
and birdsongs
